text: Have you said your goodbyes yet, Huabun?
We'll be living with James from now on.
So take one last look.
Good by my room, on this every part of you,
your concrete and wood, the faded patch of carpet
where I stood, bright busy mornings,
and long afternoons in your warm embrace,
no mere place.
You were my room, goodby my room.
Goodby my room, if I don't return to you,
it's now all over.
While I'm gone, please stay the way you are
on some distant highway.
I'll think back to you as the evening falls, these four walls.
My faithful room, goodby my room.
You were there awake when I was sleeping,
and keeping the cold night at bay.
You saw everything, the days I was lonely.
It was only you who helped me.
Good by my room, I'll keep every part of you
here in my mind, so I won't be leaving you behind.
Loyal companion, your sweet imperfections
will make it clear I was here, here in my room,
so long my room, my trusty room,
goodby my room.
